title: BBC Local Live: Stoke & Staffordshire on Tuesday 29 September 2015 - BBC News
summary: £ 1.8bn road plan set to see parts of stoke 's a500 widened .
charity says wedgwood heritage revamp could cost £ 7m .
food waste could be recycled for electricity in cheshire east .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for staffordshire and cheshire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 wednesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: your photos : peregrine falcon chicks in the city
text: here 's another from the brewood ringers group who tell me they 've been helping a peregrine falcon `` family '' in stoke-on-trent to breed .
ben dolan , from the group , said they made several improvements to the site and the falcons have raised several healthy chicks over the past couple of years .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : what does tomorrow have in store ?
text: tonight , some scattered cloud with temperatures falling away in rural areas which could lead to patches of grass frost in sheltered spots - low 3c ( 37f ) .
for tomorrow , another fine and dry day with plenty of brightness around - highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: tamworth herald : new £ 250k nightclub set to open doors
text: twenty-five jobs will be created when a new £ 250,000 nightclub opens its doors in tamworth .
author: Tamworth Herald

documents.title: news : the top stories for staffordshire and cheshire
text: from the stoke-on-trent local live newsroom
- a £ 1.8bn roads project for the west midlands could see the a500 widened in parts of stoke-on-trent
- refurbishment of the wedgwood institute in stoke-on-trent could cost almost £ 7m over the next three years , according to a charity
- cheshire east council wants to begin recycling food waste to generate electricity
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: major county route could be widened under £ 1.8bn road scheme
text: the a500 in stoke-on-trent could be widened as part of a £ 1.8bn scheme to upgrade roads across the west midlands .
the proposals have been part of a regional showcase today , which includes ideas for new smart motorways and cycling schemes .
the a50 near rocester and the m6 through staffordshire will also be improved as part of the overall project , although the a500 plans have yet to be finalised .
some sections ( of the a500 ) might be turned into dual or three lane , we might use technology to increase the capacity .
the exact details of what we 're going to do , we have n't got yet .
author: Terry Goodwin
News Editor, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: midlands tories prepare for new battles
text: as the conservative party gets ready for its autumn conference , i 've been looking at the challenges piling up thick and fast for them .
an 'in or out ? '
referendum on europe 's top of my list , with the likes of stone 's arch-eurosceptic mp bill cash expected to speak out strongly .

then there 's the police and crime commissioners elections next may , with matthew ellis currently holding staffordshire for the conservatives - and the state of the economy with jcb recently announcing 400 jobs at risk .
read all my thoughts in my latest blog ahead of this weekend 's `` sunday politics midlands '' from 11.00 on bbc one .
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: express and star : beckham photobombs midlands air ambulance award winner
text: this midlands air ambulance lifesaver has won a pride of britain award .
and been photobombed by none other than david beckham .
read the full story on the express and star website .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: travel : crash shuts road in leek
text: junction road in leek is shut both ways at the a53 broad street junction , because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: millions of pounds could be spent preserving heritage site
text: refurbishment of the wedgwood institute in stoke-on-trent could cost almost £ 7m over the next three years , according to the prince 's regeneration trust .
work started back in february on the grade ii listed building in burslem , which opened in 1863 .

last year , stoke-on-trent city council agreed to transfer the institute to the prince 's regeneration trust - they say they are fundraising for the money to pay for the next stage of the development .
author: Den Siegertsz

documents.title: the sentinel : coach calls on club to support family after suspected heart attack
text: the coach of a 17-year-old footballer who suffered a suspected heart attack while on a family holiday has issued a rallying call to help his distraught family .
author: The Sentinel

documents.title: nightclub site bought by shopping centre owners
text: the owners of a stoke-on-trent shopping centre have bought a site where a well-known nightclub used to stand in the city .
the place nightclub in hanley used to be on brewery street .
shopping centre intu potteries says the land could work with its new development containing cinema and restaurants
it 'll decide what to do with the new site once their expansion opens at the end of the year .
author: Terry Goodwin
News Editor, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: defender should be available for next home game
text: burton defender shane candsell-sherriff has recovered from the illness which forced him to miss saturday 's 2-1 win at chesterfield .
he should be available for tonight 's home match against sheffield united .
author: Owen Bradley
BBC Sport

documents.title: express and star : cancer-stricken husband showered with cards
text: a dying football fan from stafford was inundated with birthday cards as he celebrated his 36th birthday after a successful public appeal .
author: Express and Star

documents.title: your photos : sun sets on football legend
text: this photo was tweeted to @ twitterid by the mighty potters fan page on twitter , of the sir stanley matthews statue at the britannia stadium last night .
have you got a great of what you 've been up to or where you 've been in staffordshire and cheshire ?
share it with me on email , tweet it , or put on instagram ( just add # bbcstoke to the description if you agree to share .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: electricity could be generated from mouldy food
text: cheshire east council wants to begin recycling food waste .
the authority wants to spend between £ 10m and £ 30m building a special plant that would use the waste to generate electricity and create compost , which could then be sold .
the council says the plant would pay for itself and there 'd be no need for people to have an extra bin .
author: Phil McCann
Political reporter, Cheshire

documents.title: more goals is the target for crewe alex boss
text: crewe alexandra manager steve davis says he could change some of his starting 11 and his system for tonight 's game against southend .
the alex are back at home having up four points from their past two away games .
davis told bbc radio stoke he 's looking to try to get more goals into the team .
the work over the next few weeks will be trying to get those players , whoever plays up there , to combine with each other and know each other 's strengths .
author: Graham McGarry
Crewe Alexandra commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: news : top stories for staffordshire and cheshire
text: the main headlines from the stoke-on-trent local live newsroom
- the a500 in stoke-on-trent could be widened as part of a £ 1.8bn roads revamp in the west midlands
- cheshire 's fire service say one of their firefighters suffered a minor injury tackling a fire at a block of flats in crewe today
- a shopping centre 's owners says buying the site of a now demolished nightclub in stoke-on-trent was too good an opportunity to miss
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: injured defender hoping for swift return to footballryan inniss , on loan at port vale fc
text: injured defender hoping for swift return to footballryan inniss , on loan at port vale fc

documents.title: burton mail : fifth return in a year of travellers to bargates
text: travellershave returned to a site in burton town centrefor the fifth time this year .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: nantwich news : residents warned over distraction burglaries across south cheshire
text: residents in nantwich are being warned to remain vigilant after a large number of distraction burglaries across south cheshire .
author: Nantwich News

documents.title: two rescued from house fire which 'gutted ' flat
text: two people had to be rescued from the back of a flat where a fire had broken out .
firefighters say dealing with the fire involving 10 flats in crewe was tough .
cheshire fire and rescue service says it broke out in a converted house on nantwich road early this morning , gutting one flat .
everyone was accounted for .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: weather : find out the forecast for afternoon and tonight
text: for the rest of today , there should be plenty of brightness with some cloud likely to build as we go through the day .
highs of 18c ( 64f ) .
then some scattered cloud overnight with temperatures falling away in rural areas could lead to patches of grass frost in sheltered spots .
lows of 3c ( 37f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: port vale 's leitch-smith hoping to start again for side
text: port vale striker aj leitch-smith hopes he 's done enough to keep his place in the starting 11 for tonight 's game against oldham .
he made his first competitive start for the club in saturday 's 2-1 win at fleetwood .
he told bbc radio stoke that starting again would be a huge boost to his confidence .
you get judged on your goals in the end do n't you , so that 's what i need to do , score a few more goals .
author: Lee Blakeman
Port Vale commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: restaurant badly damaged in fire
text: a fire 's badly damaged part of a restaurant in sandbach , according to the fire service .
cheshire fire and rescue service sent four fire engines to the blaze at barchetta restaurant on crewe road yesterday afternoon .
it says it was a well developed fire - once it was out firefighters used a large fan to remove smoke from the building .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: burton mail : massive £ 5,000 raised to pay for biker to be buried
text: more than £ 5,000 has been raised in just four days to pay for the funeral of a motorcyclist who was killed in a crash .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: news : staffordshire and cheshire 's main stories
text: from the local live stoke-on-trent newsroom :
- the a500 in stoke-on-trent could be widened as part of a £ 2bn scheme to upgrade roads across the west midlands
- smoke alarms are the reason people escaped from 10 flats affected by a fire in crewe , according to the fire service
- the site of an iconic stoke-on-trent nightclub 's been bought by the owners of the intu potteries shopping centre
author: Mike Perkins
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: bournemouth 's wilson out for six months after stoke injury
text: bournemouth striker callum wilson is set to be out for at least six months , after scans confirmed he has ruptured his anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee .
the 23-year-old striker , who has scored five goals for the cherries in seven premier league games this season , suffered the injury in saturday 's 2-1 defeat at stoke city .
he will have an operation next week before beginning his rehabilitation .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: shopping arcade set for regeneration
text: councillors are due to vote today on whether to bring in a commercial development partner to regenerate crewe 's royal arcade .
cheshire east council bought the site for £ 6m in april .
a developer could be appointed within six months to deliver a `` leisure-led '' scheme .
author: Phil McCann
Political reporter, Cheshire

documents.title: poaching being tackled in staffordshire todaystaffordshire wildlife and countryside protection group
text: officers from the rural and wildlife crime team are holding a poaching awareness day today at cannock chase

documents.title: staffordshire newsletter : campaign to help family of student fighting for life in turkey
text: a fundraising campaign has been launched to help the family of a staffordshire teenager left fighting for his life in turkey after suffering a cardiac arrest .
author: Staffordshire Newsletter

documents.title: billions to be spent on motorway changes
text: almost £ 2bn is going to be spent on roads across the west midlands , including in staffordshire .

ten major improvement schemes are planned by highways england , including the creation of a new road linking the m54 with the m6 and m6 toll - and more four-lane sections of the m6 , m40 and m42 will be created .
the work will be done over the next five years .
midlands today will have more in our lunchtime update on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: on-air : is there life on mars ?
text: good morning - a simple question for you this morning , do you believe in alien life ?
it 's because of the announcement by nasa scientists that dark streaks seen on the surface of mars could be `` painted by liquid water '' .
that 's naturally led us all to speculate on there being life on mars - but could there be ?
or anywhere in the universe ?
send me your thoughts on email or on the bbc radio stoke facebook page .
author: Perry Spiller
Presenter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: striker 's contract dispute 'can be resolved '
text: stoke city 's chief executive tony scholes has told bbc radio stoke he is hopeful the situation with jonathan walters ' contract can be resolved .
the two parties have failed to agree terms on a new deal , and walters handed in a transfer request last month .
it would be fantastic if we are able to agree something , but the most important thing is that jon 's put that to the side and focused on his football and has been fantastic .
author: Matt Sandoz
Stoke City commentator, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: nantwich news : swimmers produce 49 personal bests at gala
text: fourteen nantwich seals swimmers achieved 49 personal bests and a series of top positions .
author: Nantwich News

documents.title: news : staffordshire and cheshire 's main stories
text: the headlines from the stoke-on-trent local live newsroom
- ten flats have been affected by a fire which has completely gutted one in crewe , says the fire service
- a commercial development partner 's going to be brought in to help regenerate part of crewe town centre
- plans to permanently move haematology services out of county hospital are being discussed at a public meeting in stafford later
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: travel : crash on a38 near lichfield
text: one lane 's closed on the a38 in weeford at the weeford island because of an accident ; there 's very slow traffic in the area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: blood disease services could permanently move out of stafford
text: plans to permanently move haematology services out of county hospital are being discussed at a public meeting in stafford tonight .
eight inpatient beds for people with blood diseases including leukaemia moved temporarily to the royal stoke in stoke-on-trent earlier this month .
bosses at the university hospitals of north midlands want to make the move permanent on the grounds of patient safety .
author: James Bovill
Political reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: flat 'gutted ' by fire in crewe
text: ten flats were affected by a fire in crewe this morning , according to the fire service , which says one was `` completely gutted '' .
cheshire fire and rescue service was called to nantwich road this morning to a block of flats - it says the fire on the ground floor spread to the floor above .
the service says there were reports of people still in the property but all the residents have now been accounted for .
author: Lamont Howie
Reporter, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: burton mail : girl 'nearly run over twice '
text: an angry father has slammed the parking of parents on the school run after he claimed his daughter almost got run over - twice .
author: Burton Mail

documents.title: travel : breakdown slows traffic on a50 in stoke
text: on the a50 in stoke-on-trent , there 's a lane shut and very slow traffic westbound between heron cross and britannia stadium , because of a broken down vehicle .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: rail services back in lichfield area after wire damagelondon midland rail firm
text: # crosscity services are operating to/from # lichfield this morning following yesterday 's overhead wire damage
@ twitterid so why has n't there been a note about the cancellation from city to ltv
@ twitterid which cancellation , chris ?
@ twitterid shame the 7:04 from northfield has `` disappeared '' from the screens when it did n't show up !
different day same service !

documents.title: your photos : 'ringed ' peregrine falcon chickemail : radio.stoke @ bbc.co.uk
text: `` are you looking at me ? ''
this great photo 's been sent in to me by ben dolan from the group brewood ringers , a group which is licensed to monitor and ring wild birds .
ben 's told me they 've been in stoke-on-trent ringing some of the peregrine falcon chicks and this is one of them from this year .
you can send me your photos of whatever you get up to in staffordshire and cheshire by email , or tweet them to @ twitterid
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: house fire tackled in crewe
text: a fire has broken out at a house in nantwich road , crewe , this morning .
cheshire fire and rescue service say crews were called at 05:45 to a property between salisbury avenue and bedford street .
the road was closed for a while but has been reopened - no further details have been released yet .
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: news : main headlines for staffordshire and cheshire
text: the top stories from the stoke-on-trent newsroom :
- there 's a public meeting in stafford tonight to discuss plans to permanently move haematology services out of county hospital
- a house fire has broken out on a main route in crewe
- a stoke-on-trent boy who 's been to go on a once-in-a-lifetime trip to florida is fundraising so other children can go next year
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: travel : crash partly blocks stoke-on-trent road
text: the a520 sandon road in meir 's partially blocked both ways near the kingsmead road junction , because of an accident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : turning bright and sunny at times
text: a chilly start to the day and any mist or fog that 's formed overnight should start to lift and clear as we go through the morning .
then after that there should be plenty of brightness with some cloud likely to build as we go through the day .
highs today of 18c ( 64f ) .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: local live : welcome to tuesday in staffordshire and cheshire
text: good morning all , it 's another sunny start to a late september day in stoke-on-trent , as you can see from this hanley i took a few minutes ago .
alex will be here shortly with a weather update for the day and we 'll also have the latest news , sport , travel , your and more throughout tuesday from across staffordshire and cheshire .
get involved yourself with comments and your photos - use email , tweet to @ twitterid or for you can use instagram , just add # bbcstoke to the description if you agree to share them with us .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live
